title: Programming Practical Competency Enhancement: Small-Sided Games for Improving Youth Soccer Tactical Behavior

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Soccer Rules and Fundamental Tactics, with Youth Education Experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can design small-sided games tailored to adolescent age-specific characteristics (U15/U17) by applying various rule conditions (e.g., 3v3, 4v4, with/without goalkeeper).
Learners can explain methods to evaluate training effectiveness using team tactical behavior analysis metrics (e.g., pass success rate, spatial utilization patterns, defensive transition efficiency).

Learners can develop strategies to induce tactical exploratory behavior by manipulating game rules (e.g., adjusting attack/defense ratios, assigning differential scoring) based on youth athletes' age and skill levels.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
